info.title: Rev REST APIs
info.description: Rev API is the primary means for developers to access, create and modify resources in Rev. Apps can read and write to the resources and mirror some of the most popular features available in Rev Web Portal such as uploading and editing videos, creating, editing, and starting webcasts, adding and removing users and groups, viewing reports and much more using the Rev API. Depending on your app’s use case, you can choose from our various APIs and implement the features accordingly.</br>All Rev APIs are based on REST architecture and are accessed via HTTPS. The complete URL is based on your Rev tenant URL and varies depending on the endpoint of the resource being accessed. For instance, you can access a user based on Rev User ID vai a a GET request to this URL: https://YOUR_REV_TENANT_URL/api/v2/users/userId.</br>Please make sure that you are familiar with the authentication and authorization approaches for Rev APIs.

post.description: This authentication API endpoint is used to authenticate individual user using user’s pre-generated API Key and Secret. Use the token that is returned in the response as the Authorization to run other public APIs. Once a session is established using this endpoint, subsequent API calls that uses the token returned from this endpoint will be limited according to the role and privileges of this particular user. Using this method, the user via API will have the same privileges and roles that user has when they login to Rev UI. This authentication mechanism can be used to automate Rev workflows using role and privileges of a given user.</br></br>Account Admins can generate user’s API Key and Secret combination. Secret is only visible at the time of generation. API Key and Secret combination can be regenerated and deleted. The key will not work for suspended users. Also authenticating a user using this method will consume a user license if the user is unlicensed

delete.description: This endpoint revokes the current user API key session.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description: ApiKey of the user revoking the token

post.description: Establish session via Username login.
This endpoint ends the login session. The userId value (provided in the login endpoint response) identifies the user who is logging out.

post.summary: Extend Login Session for All Authentication Methods
post.description: Extends the current user login session regardless of the authentication method used. This includes preventing user API key sessions and JWT authentication sessions from timing out. Successful completion returns a new expiration date and time which then expires the session at that new date and time.

This is a deprecated endpoint. Use Extend Login Session for All Authentication Methods instead. This endpoint extends the current user API key session by preventing it from timing out. Successful completion returns a new expiration date and time which then expires the session at that new date and time.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description: ApiKey of the user extending the session timeout

post.description: This is a deprecated endpoint. Use Extend Login Session for All Authentication Methods instead. This endpoint extends the current session by preventing it from timing out. Successful completion returns a new expiration date and time which expires the session at that new date and time.

get.description: This is a deprecated endpoint. Use OAuth2 Authorization instead. Successful invocation of this API results in the user being redirected to the URL specified in the redirect_uri parameter.

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description: ApiKey obtained after registering the app in Rev

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: This is a base 64 encoded string computed from the hash generated by signing verifier (below) using HMAC SHA 256 algorithm. It uses ApiKey secret as the key for signing. This is to make sure that the API sending the request has the right secret key and it has not been compromised.

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: This is required and value must be set to code. Note this is also case sensitive.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: This determines where to send the response

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: This is any state that the consumer wants to reflect back to it after approval. This is optional and the value must be url encoded.

parameters.name: verifier
parameters.description: This is a combination of Apikey and current timestamp in UTC (Apikey::Timestamp) that is used for verifying the authorization request.

200.description:
Successful response

After validating the ApiKey and signature, user is redirected back to login page with a reference to the redirect Uri. Once the user provides credentials, user is asked to grant access permissions to the client application.

If the user accepts, user is redirected back to the redirect URl provided along with an authorization code as a query parameter.

If the user denies access to the application, user is redirected to the URL but with an error query parameter.

post.description: This is a deprecated endpoint. Use OAuth2 Access Token instead. Obtains the access token that identifies the Rev user that granted access to the client.

requestBody.description: This contains the details required to generate accessToken

get.description: Successful invocation of this API results in the user being redirected to the URL specified in the redirect_uri parameter.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: client_id (ApiKey) obtained after registering the app in Rev

parameters.name: code_challenge
parameters.description: This is a base 64 encoded string computed from the hash generated by signing a code_verifier string using SHA 256 algorithm. Computation: BASE64URL-ENCODE(SHA256(ASCII(code_verifier)))

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: This is required and value must be set to code. Note this is also case sensitive.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: This determines where to send the response. It should match the registered redirect uri with rev.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: This is any state that the consumer wants to reflect back to it after approval. This is optional and the value must be url encoded.

200.description:
Successful response

After validating the client_id and redirect_uri, user will be prompted to login using the authentication mechanism configured in Rev. Once the user is successful logged into Rev, user is redirected back to the redirect uri provided along with an authorization code as a query parameter.

post.description: Obtains the access token that identifies the Rev user that granted access to the client.

requestBody.description: This contains the details required to generate accessToken

get.description: Returns a set of claims about the authorization server's configuration, including all necessary endpoints. Claims that return multiple values are represented as JSON arrays.
Checks user session health for the provided authorization header.

This authentication API endpoint is used to authenticate individual user using a JWT token. Use the token that is returned in the response as the Authorization to run other public APIs. Once a session is established using this endpoint, subsequent API calls that uses the token returned from this endpoint will be limited according to the role and privileges of this particular user. Using this method, the user via API will have the same privileges and roles that user has when they login to Rev UI. This authentication mechanism can be used to automate Rev workflows using role and privileges of a given user.</br></br>Account Admins can generate user’s API Key and Secret combination. Secret is only visible at the time of generation. API Key and Secret combination can be regenerated and deleted. The key will not work for suspended users. Also authenticating a user using this method will consume a user license if the user is unlicensed

parameters.name: jwt_token
parameters.description: JWT token that is generated using the configured tenant JWT Signing and Encryption keys. Upon validation of the token, vbrick access token is returned.

post.description: Uploads a supported video format. A full list of supported video formats can be found in the Technical Requirements guide.

parameters.name: Content-Range
parameters.description: Content-Range when uploading in multiple chunks.  Format is bytes {start byte}-{end byte}/{total file size in bytes}. The videoId is returned after the first chunk is uploaded and is required in the requestBody for subsequent chunks.

Video.description: Video metadata object. Field name is video.

VideoFile.description:
Video file to upload.

Video file content type must match with list at location http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml#video.

Please provide Content-Type header for the uploaded video file.

500.description:
Internal server error

uploader not specified or username does not exist in Rev

categoryIds incorrect or do not exist in Rev

customField does not exist in Rev or picklist values incorrect

publishDate format incorrect. Must be YYYY-MM-DD

put.description:
This endpoint is used to set or modify all metadata fields for a specific video. Note that if you are only changing one field (categories for example) all other metadata fields must also be submitted with this API call. Otherwise, those values that are not set are reset to defaults or nullified entirely.

To edit specific fields instead of all fields, use the Migrate Video and/or Edit Video Access Control endpoints instead.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of the video to edit

requestBody.description: Videos details to update. customFields note: If custom metadata field is marked required, it must be provided in API call, otherwise it is optional.If it is required and not provided, the upload is rejected.Picklist types must be valid.

patch.description:
Partially edits the metadata details of a video. You do not need to provide the fields that are not changing.

Operations supported: add,remove,copy,replace,test,move.

Keep in mind that Access Controls are strictly dictated by Roles and Permissions.

Please refer to http://jsonpatch.com/ for the format of the request body.

Examples:

using categories: [{'op': 'add', 'path': '/Categories/0', 'value': '03846100-96ac-4628-bbe3-b23a0df1081d' }]

using accessControlEntities: [{ 'op': 'replace', 'path': '/accessControlEntities/0/CanEdit', 'value': 'false' }]

Non-Editable fields [Id,ApprovalStatus,UploadedBy,WhenUploaded,LastViewed] are ignored.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of the video to edit

requestBody.description: Videos details to update. Please refer to http://jsonpatch.com/ for the format of the request body.Patch operations on Video Non-Editable fields [Id,ApprovalStatus,UploadedBy,WhenUploaded,LastViewed] will be ignored.Operations supported: add,remove,copy,replace,test,move.Add operation:  {"op": "add", "path": "/Categories/0", "value": "03846100-96ac-4628-bbe3-b23a0df1081d" }.Replace operation:{ "op": "replace", "path": "/accessControlEntities/0/CanEdit", "value": "false" }

delete.description: This endpoint deletes a video asset from Rev. This includes videos stored on a DME.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to delete

put.description:
This endpoint edits the Access Control permissions on a specific video.

Allows Access Control entities to be set for all four types. Note that if set to Public, the Public setting must first be enabled on the Rev account and a password may then be set if desired. If set to Channels, there should be one valid Channel in the account, otherwise the request is rejected. The default setting is Private.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to modify access to

requestBody.description: Video Access Control Request

post.description: This endpoint allows you to trim videos that are hosted in Rev.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to trim

requestBody.description: trim video request

get.description: Retrieves video details and metadata of a given video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of the video to get details

get.description:
This endpoint retrieves the current status of a specific video during upload and when upload is complete. To know whether a video is fully processed, including transcoding, use the field isProcessing along with with status state that is returned in the response.

For example, if the value of isProcessing is FALSE and the status is Ready, then the video has been fully processed. If the value of isProcessing is TRUE and status is Ready, then it means the video is available for playback but the transcoding process is still in progress.

The progress of the overall processing of the video can be tracked using the field overallProgress whose value ranges from 0.0 to 1.0 where 1.0 means that the processing is 100% completed.

Possible status states during upload: [NotUploaded, Uploading, UploadingFinished, Ingesting, Processing]

Possible final status states once upload is complete: [Canceled, UploadFailed, ProcessingFailed, Ready, ReadyButProcessingFailed]

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to retrieve status state

get.description: This endpoint retrieves basic details , embed playback URL and thumbnail URL for a given video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video

get.description: Retrieve a list of all playback urls for a given video Id.  This endpoint also accounts for Zone logic.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: Device user agent. This is used for determining the stream to deliver

schema.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/93.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of the video to get urls

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: IP addresses of user/client with comma separated values (Example: 127.0.0.0, 10.0.10.124). This is used for Zoning rules in determining the streams to return.

get.description: Retrieves the summary statistics of a given video and most often relates to viewing statistics such as total views, completion rate, unique views and so forth. You can specify a before and after date range or return the entire summary by leaving before and after dates blank.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video for summary retrieval

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: If an after date is supplied, summary statistics are calculated based on views from after this date. If no dates are specified, summary statistics for all time is returned.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: If a before date is supplied, summary statistics are calculated based on views before this date. If no dates are specified, summary statistics for all time will be returned.

put.description: This endpoint replaces a given video with one that you upload.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to replace OR id of video when uploading multiple chunks after the first chunk

requestBody.description:
Video file to upload.

Video file content type must match with list at location http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml#video

Please provide Content-Type header for the uploaded video file.

VideoFile.description:
Video file to upload.

Video file content type must match with list at location http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml#video.

Please provide Content-Type header for the uploaded video file.

post.description: Uploads an alternate image to be used as a thumbnail for a specified video. Rev auto-generates a default thumbnail if you do not upload one of your choice. Note that if you replace Rev’s auto-generated thumbnail with one that you upload it will be deleted and may not be recovered.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to upload image

ThumbnailFile.description:
Thumbnail image file.

Accepted file types: [.jpg, .png, .gif]

Please provide Content-Type header for the uploaded files.

head.description: Get the video thumbnail file header info. The HEAD method is a pre-flight query that returns the size and mime-type to be added to the response Headers.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description:
File key of the video thumbnail to download.

Obtained via the Get Video Metadata endpoint and the thumbnailKey property that is returned.

get.description: Downloads the video thumbnail image file without authorization if Private Metadata Sharing is enabled. If Private Metadata Sharing is not enabled, access to the thumbnail is determined by the video view rights.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description:
File key of the video thumbnail to download.

Obtained via the Get Video Metadata endpoint and the thumbnailKey property that is returned.

get.description: Gets the video thumbnail image for a given video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of the video to get thumbnail image.

post.description: This endpoint uploads a chapter(s) for a specified video. Posting chapters replaces all existing chapters a video contains. There can be multiple chapter titles and start times. The endpoint requires the user have edit rights to the video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to upload chapters to

File.description:
Video chapter image file(s) to upload.

Video chapter image file content type must match with list at location http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml#image.

Please provide Content-Type and Content-Disposition headers for the uploaded image file(s). The filename(s) should match the imageFiles specified in the Chapters json payload

put.description:
This endpoint uploads and edits a chapter(s) for a specified video. Using the PUT method (editing) chapters replaces an existing chapter if it is a duplicate timestamp.

New chapters are created if the chapter does not exist at the specified timestamp. There can be multiple chapter titles and start times.

The endpoint requires the user have edit rights to the video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to upload chapters to

File.description:
Video chapter image file to upload.

Video Chapter image file content type must match with list at location http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml#image.

Please provide Content-Type and Content-Disposition headers for the uploaded image file(s). The filename(s) should match the imageFiles specified in the Chapters json payload

get.description: Returns all video chapters that have been uploaded for a given video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of the video to get chapters

400.description: Bad request</br>video id does not exist

401.description: Unauthorized error</br>user does not have view rights</br>user not a system user

delete.description: Deletes all (or specified) video chapters that have been uploaded for a given video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of the video

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: List of video chapter start time(s) (comma delimited) to delete. An empty value means to delete all chapters associated to the video.

post.description: This endpoint uploads one or more supplemental files to associate with a specified video. Typical file types include PowerPoint and PDF documents that provide a viewer with additional information.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to upload supplemental files

Files.description:
Supported Supplemental File types you may upload are found in the Technical Requirements guides.

Please provide Content-Type header for each file you upload.

SupplementalFiles.description: Supplemental files metadata object.  Field name is SupplementalFiles.

500.description:
Internal server error

Errors may include:

MalformedRequest = Bad request format. Please check your request

FileNotSupported = Sorry! Cannot upload this file type.

FileNotSent = The video file was not uploaded.

UserNotProvided = Unable to upload video. Please ensure that video is associated to a valid user.

UserDoesNotExist = Unable to upload video. Please ensure that video is associated to a valid user.

InternalServerError = Unable to process request at this time. Please try again later.

get.description: Retrieve the supplemental files of a video. This endpoint requires view access and returns a blank array if there are no supplemental files associated to the video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to get the supplemental files

delete.description: Deletes all or specific supplemental files for a given video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of the video

parameters.name: fileIds
parameters.description: Provide fileIds separated by a ',' to delete specific supplemental files. If fileIds not provided, then all supplemental files associated to that video will be deleted.

get.description: Downloads a supplemental file based on the video and file Id provided. This endpoint requires view rights for the video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: File Id of the video's supplemental file to download

401.description:
Unauthorized error

Returned if videoId not valid

404.description:
Resource not found

Returned if videoId or fileId not provided

Returned if no fileId with that name

post.description: Upload transcriptions / subtitles for a video for hearing impaired viewers or subtitles in different language. Only .srt or .vtt files are supported.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to set transcription files

File.description:
Transcription files.

Please provide Content-Type header for the uploaded files.

Accepted values are text/plain or application/octetstream

post.description:
This endpoint uploads a PowerPoint presentation to create chapters for a specified video.

Posting chapters replaces all existing chapters a video contains. The first slide begins at 00:00:00 with the rest evenly distributed throughout the duration of the video. The slide titles are the names of the chapter titles. If there are slides without titles, the slide number is the title. The endpoint requires the user have edit rights to the video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to set presentation chapters

PresentationFile.description:
Presentation File.

Please provide Content-Type header for the uploaded files. Accepted values are text/plain or application/octetstream

put.description:
This endpoint uploads and updates a webcast branding settings for a specified webcast.

The endpoint requires the user have edit rights to the webcast.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: Id of webcast to set the branding

LogoImageFile.description:
Logo Image File.

Logo image file content type must match with list at location http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml#image.

Please provide Content-Type header for the uploaded image file.

BackgroundImageFile.description:
Background Image File.

Background image image file content type must match with list at location http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml#image.

Please provide Content-Type header for the uploaded image file.

get.description:
Retrieves the status of all presentation file chapters that have been uploaded for a specified video.

Status return values can be [Initialized, InProgress, Completed, Error]

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to get the presentation chapter status

put.description: This endpoint is used to submit a numerical rating on a specified video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to set rating

requestBody.description: Rating of video. Example, rating=4.

put.description:
This endpoint is used to submit a comment on a specified video. The username that submits the comment must exist in Rev.

This endpoint will be deprecated in favor of the Add Video Comments endpoint.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to submit comments for

requestBody.description: Request body to be submitted

get.description: Returns list of comments for a given video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to get comments

parameters.name: showAll
parameters.description: Default=false. If true, then admin accounts only can see un-redacted values of comments.</br></br>This includes the comment text, isRemoved (signifies a deleted comment), deletedBy (user name that deleted the comment), and deletedWhen (date and time it was deleted).

delete.description: Delete all comments or specific comments for a given video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to delete comments

parameters.name: commentIds
parameters.description: If commentIds are not provided, then all comments for that video will be deleted. To delete specific comments , provide comma-separated commentIds.

post.description: This endpoint is used to add a comment on a specified video. The username that submits the comment must exist in Rev. If a valid commentId is specified in the request, a child comment will be created. If commentId is not specified, a parent comment will be created.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to submit comments for

requestBody.description: Request body to be submitted

401.description: Unauthorized error. Parent comment does not exist.

put.description: Transcode video on-demand with new presets. This endpoint bypasses the need to upload the video again.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to transcode

get.description: This endpoint mimics the search control in the Rev portal. All results are based on the authenticated user making the API request.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter the results based on the channels and categories the Principal is subscribed OR apply the recommendation logic which boosts search results based on recent viewing history using up to the last 10 videos viewed by a user.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of video (Live/Vod)

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description:
List of Category Ids to specify searching videos only in those categories.

Example: Categories=a0e5cbf6-95cb-46e7-8600-4c07bc31f80b, b1f5cbf6-95cb-46e7-8600-4c07bc31g9pc.

Pass a blank entry to return uncategorized videos. Example: Categories=

parameters.name: uploaders
parameters.description: Include the first name and last name of the uploader.  Note that partial matches may be returned. Example: uploaders="john doe" is going to retrieve all videos uploaded by the user with first name and last name = "john doe". To return an exact result you must use the uploaderIds query string.

parameters.name: uploaderIds
parameters.description: Uploader GUIDs to get specific videos uploaded by these users. Example: UploaderIds=abc, xyz

parameters.name: owners
parameters.description: Include the first name and last name of the owner.  Note that partial matches may be returned. Example: owners="john doe" is going to retrieve all videos owned by the user with first name and last name = "john doe". To return an exact result you must use the ownerIds query string.

parameters.name: ownerIds
parameters.description: Owner GUIDs to get specific videos owner by these users. Example: ownerIds=abc, xyz

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of video (Active/Inactive)

parameters.name: fromPublishedDate
parameters.description: Valid video published date

parameters.name: toPublishedDate
parameters.description: Valid video published date

parameters.name: fromUploadDate
parameters.description: Valid video upload date

parameters.name: toUploadDate
parameters.description: Valid video upload date

parameters.name: fromModifiedDate
parameters.description: Valid video modified date

parameters.name: toModifiedDate
parameters.description: Valid video modified date

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search string

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of videos to get. (By default count is 50)

parameters.name: scrollId
parameters.description: If totalVideos > count, then provide the scrollId returned from the first request to get the next set of videos like (scrollId=abc)

parameters.name: exactMatch
parameters.description: If true, search is performed as exact match on title, tags, categories, and uploader.

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: If provided, query results are sorted based on field(title, whenUploaded, uploaderName, duration, _score). Default is set to title.

parameters.name: unlisted
parameters.description: If provided, the query string fetches the unlisted setting of the video. This can be listed only, unlisted only, or to return all. Default setting fetches the listed only videos.

parameters.name: searchField
parameters.description: If provided, the query results are fetched on the provided searchField only. If the exactMatch flag is also set along with searchField, then the results are fetched for an exact match on the provided searchField only.

parameters.name: includeTranscriptSnippets
parameters.description: If true, search results include inner hits from transcription files. Default is false.

parameters.name: recommendedFor
parameters.description: Show recommended videos for the specified Username. Videos returned are based on the user’s last 10 viewed videos. Must be Account Admin or Media Admin to use this query. Sort order must be _score. User must exist.

parameters.name: hasHls
parameters.description: If true, only HLS videos are returned.

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: If channelId provided, videos in that particular channel are returned. User should have rights to the channel.

get.description: Returns a list of public videos by category, status, and related metadata.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description:
List of Category Ids to specify searching videos only in those categories.

Example: Categories=a0e5cbf6-95cb-46e7-8600-4c07bc31f80b, b1f5cbf6-95cb-46e7-8600-4c07bc31g9pc.

Pass a blank entry to return uncategorized videos. Example: Categories=

post.description: Creates a manually entered URL. Live and Stored video links are supported.

requestBody.description: Video metadata object. For linkedUrl:Type=Live/VodIsMulticast= true/falseEncodingType= h264/hls/hds/h264ts /mpeg4/mpeg2/wm

get.description: This endpoint downloads a video asset from Rev. The original file upload is downloaded.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to download

get.description:
Gets oEmbed JSON data for a given video for video embedding. This is typically used for integrations into other social systems with activity feeds so users can watch video inline of an activity feed. The Rev Shared URL is also an acceptable format as noted in the example(s) below.

This API does not require an authorization header.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Rev URL of video to embed must be URL (Percent) Encoded. Please refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding for details and example usage above.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Height of video to embed

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Width of video to embed

parameters.name: autoplay
parameters.description: Set if video autoplays on load

post.description: This endpoint selects a transcription integration and generates a transcription file for a specified video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of the video to transcribe

requestBody.description: Video to transcribe using the language and service type in the request.

get.description: Get the status of a video transcription.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to get status

parameters.name: transcriptionId
parameters.description: Transcription Id of video to get status

get.description: Downloads a video transcription file.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to download

parameters.name: languageId
parameters.description: Language Id of the video transcription to download

post.description: Translates a specified video. You must include both the source language and an array of target languages to translate the source language to. You must also have the Rev IQ User role to use this function.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of the video to translate

requestBody.description: Video to translate using the source language and target languages in the request.

get.description: Get status of a video translation.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to get status

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: language Id of video to get status

get.description: Get transcription files of a video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of video to get the transcription files

delete.description: Deletes all or specific transcription files for a given video.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of the video

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Provide locales separated by a ',' to delete specific transcription files. If locale not provided, then all transcription files associated to that video are deleted.

post.description: This endpoint sends a video for Facial Recognition and tags the user accounts recognized in the video. The Rev account must have Facial Recognition activated and the user account must be enabled for recognition (i.e., profile not opted out and have a recognizable profile picture uploaded). You must also have the Rev IQ User role to use this function.

parameters.name: videoId
parameters.description: Id of the video to use in tagging users

400.description:
Bad request

This account has insufficient Rev IQ credits to complete the action.

Video is too large for user tagging.

Video codec or container is incorrect.

401.description:
Unauthorized error

Rev IQ/Facial Recognition is not enabled for this account.

patch.description:
Partially edits the details of a webcast. You do not need to provide the fields that you are not changing.

Webcast status determines which fields are modifiable and when.

If the webcast pre-production or main event is in progress, only fields available for inline editing may be patched/edited.

If the webcast main event has been run once, only fields available after the webcast has ended are available for editing. That includes all fields with the exception of start/end dates, lobbyTimeMinutes, preProduction, duration, userIds, and groupIds.

If the webcast end time has passed and is Completed, only edits to linkedVideoId and redirectVod are allowed.

Event Admins can be removed using their email addresses as path pointer for the fields 'EventAdminEmails' and 'EventAdmins', provided that all of the Event Admins associated with the webcast have email addresses. This is also applicable for the field 'Moderators'.

Keep in mind that Access Controls are strictly dictated by Roles and Permissions.

Please refer to http://jsonpatch.com/ for the format of the request body.

Examples:

using EventAdmins: [{ 'op': 'remove', 'path': '/EventAdmins/Email', 'value': 'x1@test.com' }]

using EventAdminEmails: [{ 'op': 'remove', 'path': '/EventAdminEmails', 'value': 'x2@test.com' }]

using Moderators: [{ 'op': 'remove', 'path': '/Moderators/Email', 'value': 'x3@test.com' }]

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: Id of the webcast to edit

requestBody.description:
Webcast details to update. Please refer to http://jsonpatch.com/ for the format of the request body.

Patch operations on Webcast details editable fields are similar to the Edit Webcast

Operations supported: add,remove,copy,replace,test,move.

patch.description:
Partially edits the members and details of a channel. You do not need to provide the fields that you are not changing.

Please refer to http://jsonpatch.com/ for the format of the request body.

Examples:

To add members: [{'op': 'add', 'path': '/Members/-', 'value': {'id': '0e2a1bfc-0a36-4ee1e-ac1e-3647b256537d','type': 'Group','roleTypes': ['Member','Contributor']}} ]

To remove members : [{ 'op': 'remove', 'path': '/Members', 'value': '63a76eb9-fa62-46e0-bdb5-c8ad34aec086' }]

To update channel name : [{ 'op': 'replace', 'path': '/Name', 'value': 'New Name' }]

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: Id of the channel to patch

requestBody.description:
Channels details to update. Please refer to http://jsonpatch.com/ for the format of the request body.

videoAccessControl.description:
This sets access control for the video. This is an enum and can have the following values: Public/AllUsers/Private.

A value of AllUsers is equal to all internal/authenticated users. A value of Private allows access to those Users, Groups, and Channels explicitly identified.

Be aware that you can assign multiple Users, Groups, and Channels in the accessControlEntites parameter in addition to the AllUser or Public settings. If no value is set, the default is Private.

In the case of an incorrect value, the call is rejected with an HTTP 400 error.

Note: If Channels is set at the videoAccessControl, it is translated to Private and a Channel must be specified in the accessControlEntities. If a Channel is included in the accessControlEntities, then the canEdit parameter is ignored.

totalTime.description: Total viewing time in timespan format (e.g. 00:00:00)

averageTime.description: Average viewing time in timespan format (e.g. 00:00:00)

startTime.description: Chapter's start time using a timespan format (e.g. 00:00:00). The value is unique and cannot be the same as other start times.

password.description: This is a shared password for public guests. This field exists only in the response if the user has EDIT permission to the video.

expirationAction.description: This sets action when video expires. This is an enum and can have the following values: Delete/Inactivate.

categories.description: List of category IDs. If you use categoryIds and they do not exist/are incorrect, the request is rejected. The request is also rejected if you do not have contribute rights to a restricted category and you attempt to add/edit or otherwise modify it.

tags.description: Assign the video to multiple tag GUIDs if desired

expirationDate.description: Date field to prompt expirationAction. Format must be: YYYY-MM-DD.

expirationAction.description: This sets action when video expires. This is an enum and can have the following values: Delete/Inactivate.

publishDate.description: By default, the publishDate is set to the current date the video is set to Active. You can also set the publishDate to a date in the future to make the video Active. If the video is already Active, the publishDate can be set to a date in the past. Format must be YYYY-MM-DD to avoid generating an error.

enableRatings.description: Default=true. Allows video to be rated.

enableDownloads.description: Default=true. Allows video to be downloaded.

enableComments.description: Default=true. Allows comments on the video.

password.description: Used if the videoAccessControl is set to Public.

customFields.description: Custom Fields to change. Custom Fields marked as required MUST be included in the array. Other custom fields are optional - supplied values will overwrite existing values

unlisted.description: Default=false. Specifies if the video is unlisted.  If unlisted, it is not visible or searchable in the Rev UI by other users.

userTags.description: An array of user ids that are tagged in the video. The account must be licensed and enabled for Facial Recognition. If the user does not exist, a 500 error is returned.

owner.description:
By default, video owner is the user uploader unless otherwise assigned. The video owner automatically has view and edit rights and can include the Media Viewer role.

If a video owner is assigned, the uploader does not retain view/edit rights unless granted in video access controls.

viewerIdEnabled.description: Default=false. Displays viewer information over the video for playback on the web.

childComments.description: This array will always be empty for comments that have a parent

userName.description: Used to login to Rev. Not case sensitive but must be unique.

email.description: Must be a vaild email format. Required.

title.description: Allows assignment of a title to the user

language.description: Preferred language. Two digit language code. For example, en for English. View Supported Languages for codes.

groupIds.description: Group Ids to assign the user to

roleIds.description: Role Ids to assign the user to. Default=Media Viewer.

username.description: Username of account trying to login

password.description: Password of account trying to login

email.description: Must be a vaild email format. Required and must be unique. Email is used for validation and cannot be updated. Should match with provided registrationId user mail.

token.description: Guest user token that can be used on the webcast link to the public event to automatically log the public user into the event.

eventId.description: EventId of the webcast for which guest user registered.

registrationId.description: RegistrationId. Id of the registered guest user.

token.description: Guest user token that can be used on the webcast link to the public event to automatically log the public user into the event.

scrollId.description: ScrollId Used for retrieving next set of guestusers.

email.description: Must be a vaild email format. Required and must be unique. Email is used for validation and cannot be updated. Should match with provided registrationId user mail.

type.description: Type of resource to subscribe or unsubscribe to, either channel or category.

userIds.description: User Ids to add to Group

roleIds.description: Role Ids to add to Group

rating.description: Numerical rating. Numbers 1 to 5. Must be a whole number, no decimals.

language.description: View the latest Supported Languages in Rev technical requirements.

serviceType.description: Vbrick, Voicebase, or null. If both are enabled, then Vbrick is used. If type = Vbrick, only Rev IQ user role can use this service/endpoint. This applies only if serviceType is Vbrick.

transcriptionService.description: Type of transcription service to use by Rev for the video transcription.

translationRequest.description: View the latest Supported Languages in Rev technical requirements for sourceLanguage and targetLanguages.

userName.description: The uploader is set to this user

owner.description: The video ownership is set to this user. Only the owner.userId is used for lookup

uploadedBy.description: Taken from the userName that uploaded the video

whenUploaded.description: Upload date is set to this value. Example: 2019-02-26 15:53:12

publishDate.description:
By default, the publishDate is set to the current date the video is set to Active status. You can also set the publishDate to a date in the future to make the video Active at that time. If the video is already Active, the publishDate can be set to a date in the past.

Note: Format must be YYYY-MM-DD to avoid generating an error.

legacyViewCount.description: Retain the total views count from an outside system as an optional param.

time.description: Chapter's start time using a timespan format (e.g. 00:00:00). The value is unique and cannot be the same as other start times.

imageFile.description:
Chapter image filename. This value is unique, and should match the filename of the image file payload.

Please provide Content-Type header for the uploaded image file.

userId.description: Rev UserId identifies the user the media is attached to. If the Id does not exist in Rev, the request is rejected.

username.description: Rev Username identifies the user the media is attached to. If the Username does not exist in Rev, the request is rejected.

email.description: Rev Email identifies the user the media is attached to. If the Email does not exist in Rev, the request is rejected.

title.description: Video title. If not specified, API uses uploaded filename as the title.

description.description: Description is set to null if not specified

uploader.description: Rev username identifies the user the video is attached to. If not specified, or the username does not exist in Rev, the upload is rejected.

owner.description:
By default, video owner is the user uploader unless otherwise assigned. The video owner automatically has view and edit rights and can include the Media Viewer role.

If a video owner is assigned, the uploader does not retain view/edit rights unless granted in video access controls.

categories.description:
An array of category names attached to the video. If no categories are specified, or the category does not exist in Rev, no categories are attached. The request is also rejected if you do not have contribute rights to a restricted category and you attempt to add/edit or otherwise modify it.

This array is provided through the video metadata file and obtained through the Get Categories endpoint.

You should only use categories OR categoryIds but not both.

categoryIds.description:
An array of category Ids attached to the video. If the category does not exist in Rev, the upload fails. The request is also rejected if you do not have contribute rights to a restricted category and you attempt to add/edit or otherwise modify it.

This array is provided through the video metadata file and obtained through the Get Categories endpoint.

You should only use categories OR categoryIds but not both.

tags.description: An array of strings tagged to the video

isActive.description: Default=false. Status of the video after it is uploaded.

enableRatings.description: Default=true. This enables or disables ratings for the uploaded video.

enableDownloads.description: Default=false. This enables or disables downloading of the video from Rev.

enableComments.description: Default=true. This enables or disables ability to comment on uploaded video.

password.description: A password for Public Video Access Control. Use this field when the videoAccessControl is set to Public only. Otherwise, this field is ignored.

customFields.description:
An array of customFields attached to a video/webcast. If the customField does not exist in Rev or invalid values found for picklist, the upload fails. If values are not provided for a picklist and/or text field, they are not set for the video but the upload proceeds. The Get Custom Fields endpoint retrieves a list of custom fields.

Note: If custom field is marked required in Rev, it must be provided in API call, otherwise it is optional. If it is required and not provided, the upload is rejected. Picklist types must be valid.

sourceType.description: Specifies where the video originated. Possible values are 'REV', 'WEBEX', 'API', 'VIDEO CONFERENCE', 'WebexLiveStream', 'LiveEnrichment'

doNotTranscode.description: Default=false. This enables the video to bypass transcoding.

is360.description: Default=false. This enables the 360 video flag.

unlisted.description: Default=false. This enables the unlisted video flag.

publishDate.description: Date the video is published. If IsActive is set to true and PublishDate is not specified, a default value is set (i.e. Today's date). This should be specified based on the date in the the timezone of the current account.

userTags.description: An array of user Ids tagged in the video

viewerIdEnabled.description: Default=false. Displays viewer information over the video for playback on the web.

videoId.description: Required when uploading in multiple chunks. The videoId is returned in the first chunked upload call, and should be included here for each subsequent request

legacyViewCount.description: Retain the total views count from an outside system as an optional param.

macAddress.description: MAC address for the DME. Must be unique to the Rev account.

isActive.description: Default=false. Specifies if the DME is currently active.

prepositionContent.description: Default=false. Specifies if the DME should preposition content.

isVideoStorageDevice.description: Default=false. Specifies the DME as a storage device.

dmeVideoStream.description: Used to manually add video streams to the DME.

isMulticast.description: Specifies if the stream is a multicast stream

dmeVideoStreamGroup.description: Used to add an HLS stream, required for mobile devices.  This is not added by default.

hasHls.description: Specify if an HLS stream is created

description.description: Plain-text description for your webcast that displays as part of the Webcast Landing page before the event starts and as part of the Event Details section after broadcasting begins. The description also becomes part of the invitation text to attendees.

htmlDescription.description: Rich-text (basic HTML markup) description for your webcast that displays as part of the Webcast Landing page before the event starts and as part of the Event Details section after broadcasting begins.

presentationProfileId.description: GUID for the presentation profile. Only included when Presentation Profile selected as a videoSourceType.

automatedWebcast.description: Default=false. If enabled event to begin broadcasting at the appointed start time on its own without an Event Host to start it. Only applicable when videoSourceType is Presentation Profile

closedCaptionsEnabled.description: Default=false. Specifies if embedded closed captions are passed through from HLS video stream. Only applicable when Presentation Profile used as a video source.

userPollsResponse.description: If set to LogAll then individual attendee's responses are recorded and included in the post-event Poll report.

questionAndAnswerEnabled.description: Default=false, Select to enable Q&A feature in the webcast

userIds.description: Ids for users on the access control list. Only used with Private events.

groupIds.description: Ids for groups on the access control list. Only used with Private events.

moderatorIds.description: Ids for users that will serve as webcast moderators.

vcSipAddress.description: SIP address if recording a video conference as the source. Only required if the video source type is SipAddress or Pexip.

autoplay.description: Default=false. Determines how a broadcasting Webcast behaves when a viewer joins. Enabled, it plays immediately and is muted. Disabled, there is a button to start the Webcast and it is not muted.

disableAutoRecording.description:
Default=false. If false, the webcast is automatically recorded.

Note: When false, attempted use of the Start Webcast Recording endpoint generates an error.

vodId.description: Video Id of source video when 'Vod' selected as a videoSourceType.

presenterId.description: Internal user Id. Only used when 'WebrtcSinglePresenter' selected as a videoSourceType.

presenterIds.description: Internal user Ids. Only used when 'Producer' selected as a videoSourceType.

externalPresenters.description: Only used when 'Producer' selected as a videoSourceType.

producerBgImages.description: This is available only for producer webcasts.

eventAccessControl.description:
access control for the webcast. This is an enum and can have the following values: Public/TrustedPublic/AllUsers/Private.

Note: This parameter is strictly controlled by Roles and Permissions. TrustedPublic is only applicable for Partners and WebexEvents type webcasts.

eventSourceType.description:
This is an enum and can have the following values: PresentationProfile, Rtmp, SipAddress, WebexTeam, WebexLiveStream, Zoom, Vod, Pexip, WebrtcSinglePresenter.

Note that WebrtcSinglePresenter represents Webcam and Screenshare source in rev UI. This field is required to create/edit WebexLiveStream event.

sbmlRequest.description: Required for Webcasts with WebexLiveStream as a video source. This is the base64encoded string of the SBML json.

name.description: The name that appears to attendees and that appears on the flyout tab during the webcast.

code.description: The third-party URL or embed code. Look for this on the application or website that you will be embedding. This can usually be found in its Admin or Settings section.

icon.description: Icon that is assigned to the flyout tab and is clicked to open. Accepted values: abc-text, barchart, group-2, group-3, person-check, person-record, person-wave, poll-chart, end, smile-face, vote-box

name.description: Provides a description of the link for the attendee.

link.description: The link/URL that opens when clicked.

isEnabled.description: Only manual type push content links are enabled/disabled. At end links appear when the webcast ends.

liveSubtitles.description: For enabling live subtitles on the webcast. Enabling subtitles requires Rev IQ license hours and the Rev IQ User role.

sourceLanguage.description: Language code. View Supported Languages for source languages in Technical Requirements.

translationLanguages.description: Language code. View Supported Languages for translation languages in Technical Requirements.

patchRequest.description: Refer to http://jsonpatch.com/ for the format of the request body.

op.description: Operations supported: [add, remove, copy, replace, test, move]

jwtToken.description: This token is used for sending analytics data and is valid for 24 hours only.

description.description: Extended description for your webcast that displays as part of the Webcast Landing page before the event starts and as part of the Event Details section after broadcasting begins. The description also becomes part of the invitation text to attendees.

presentationProfileId.description: GUID for the presentation profile. Only required when Presentation Profile selected as a videoSourceType.

eventAdminIds.description: Array of user Ids for the Webcast admins. If no Ids are passed, eventAdminEmails are checked.

automatedWebcast.description: Default=false. Enable if Presentation Profile used as a video source and if you want the event to begin broadcasting at the appointed start time on its own without an Event Host to start it.

closedCaptionsEnabled.description: Default=false. Specifies if embedded closed captions in HLS video stream are enabled when Presentation Profile used as a video source. This is separate from the live subtitles (RevIQ) feature

pollsEnabled.description: Default=false. Select to enable polls in the webcast.

userPollsResponse.description: If set to LogAll then individual attendee's responses are recorded and included in the post-event Poll report.

chatEnabled.description: Default=true. Select to enable chat in the webcast.

questionAndAnswerEnabled.description: Default=false, Select to enable Q&A feature in the webcast

userIds.description: Ids for users on the access control list. Only used with Private events.

groupIds.description: Ids for groups on the access control list. Only used with Private events.

moderatorIds.description: Ids for users that will serve as webcast moderators.

password.description: Used only if isPublic is set to true.

vcSipAddress.description: SIP address if recording a video conference as the source. Only required if the video source type is SipAddress or Pexip.

isSecureRtmp.description: Default=true, Specifies if the RTMP based webcast should use RTMPS or RTMP. True will set to RTMPS and false will set to RTMP.

presentationFileDownloadAllowed.description: Default=false. Specifies if a presentation attached to the webcast is downloadable

categories.description: Array of categoryIds to assign the event to. If you use categoryIds and they do not exist/are incorrect, the request is rejected. The request is also rejected if you do not have contribute rights to a restricted/secure category and you attempt to add/edit or otherwise modify it.

tags.description: Array of tag Ids to assign the event to. Can assign to multiple tags.

unlisted.description: Default=false. Specifies if the webcast is unlisted. If it is unlisted, prevents it from being displayed to all Media Contributors, Media Viewers, and Event Hosts that did not create the Webcast. Further, resulting videos recorded are not visible or searchable in the Rev UI.

estimatedAttendees.description: Number between 0 and 1000000. Allows you to estimate the number of people that will attend so technical resources can be adjusted as needed.

lobbyTimeMinutes.description: May not exceed 120. Period of time before a Webcast starts when attendees are permitted to join the event.

shortcutName.description:
Creates a custom event-friendly URL for a Webcast that makes it easier to remember for attendees. May be reused for multiple events as long as they do not conflict in date and time.

This Url is returned in the parameter shortcutNameUrl when the Get Webcast Details endpoint is untilized.

linkedVideoId.description: Use to set the Id of a video that is linked/associated to a Webcast that has finished recording.

autoAssociateVod.description: Default=true. When true, the video in LinkedVideoId is automatically linked to a Webcast after it has concluded.

redirectVod.description: Default=true. When true, users that access the Webcast are automatically redirected to the video set in LinkedVideoId. If false, they are directed the Webcast Landing page instead.

registrationFieldIds.description: If accessControl is set to Public, you can add custom fields to the Webcast to collect more data from public attendees. Use Ids returned in the Add Webcast Registration Fields endpoint to specify the fields to use.

isCustomConsentEnabled.description: Default=false. If accessControl is set to Public and 'EDIT PUBLIC REG. PAGE CONSENT VERBIAGE' is enabled on the account. When true, you can customize the consent verbiage for public attendees.

consentVerbiage.description: If isCustomConsentEnabled is true then you can customize the consent verbiage for public attendees.

autoplay.description: Default=false. Determines how a broadcasting Webcast behaves when a viewer joins. Enabled, it plays immediately and is muted. Disabled, there is a button to start the Webcast and it is not muted.

disableAutoRecording.description:
Default=false. If false, the webcast is automatically recorded.

Note: When false, attempted use of the Start Webcast Recording endpoint generates an error.

hideShareUrl.description: Default=false. When true, the Webcast URL is hidden on the Event Details page that is displayed to attendees while it is broadcasting.

recordingUploaderUserId.description: Id of the user who is set as the uploader for the event recording.

recordingUploaderUserEmail.description: Used if recordingUploaderUserId is not provided. Email of the user who is set as the uploader for the event recording.

emailToPreRegistrants.description: Default=false. If true, registrants will automatically receive an email with the details they need to join the event.

vodId.description: Video Id. Only required when 'Vod' selected as a videoSourceType. Video must be Hls.

presenterId.description: Internal user Id. Only required when 'WebrtcSinglePresenter' selected as a videoSourceType.

presenterIds.description: Internal user Ids. Only required when 'Producer' selected as a videoSourceType.

pushContent.description: Maximum allowed push content links are five only.
