viewerIdEnabled.description: Default=false. Displays viewer information over the video for playback on the web.

externalPresenters.description: Only required when 'Producer' selected as a videoSourceType.

regenerateRtmpUrlAndKey.description: Default=false, Specifies if the exiting RTMP based webcast URL and Key needs to be regenerated.

userAccessEntity.description:
Array of users who are moderators. This is equivalent to Panelists in Webex.

Note: For Partners, auto creation of hosts/moderators occurs if user is not in Rev and new fields are used. This is only available for Account Admins. Email and lastName are required for user auto creation.

hostAccessEntity.description: Array of users who are Webex Hosts and Co-hosts (In Vbrick, Event Admins).

isPrimary.description: To be set to true for 1 eventAdmin in the list of eventAdmins when sending the request. The user (Webex Host) with isPrimary set to true is the Primary Host of the event and rest of the users are the co-hosts. Only one eventAdmin (Webex Host) in this list can be set to Primary.

imageUrls.description: Image Urls retrieved only for producer/presenters.

deleteEventsRequest.description: At least one of the parameters should be specified in the request. If all of the search terms are not provided in the request, a Bad Request response is returned by Rev. If both the startDate and endDate search terms are not provided, they are defaulted to set a range equal to one year (i.e. 365 days).

startDate.description: Search parameter to use to match those events that are set to start on or after the date specified. Value should be less than or equal to endDate. If not specified, it assumes a value of endDate - 365 days.

endDate.description: Search parameter to use to match those events that are set to start on or before the date specified. Value should be greater than or equal to startDate. If not specified, it assumes a value of the current date.

customFields.description: List of custom fields to use when searching for events to delete. All of the fields provided are concatenated as AND in the search request. The value to the property 'Value' is required.

eventAccessControlEntitiesRequest.description: Use to provide updates to Access Controls of Private Events.

userIds.description: User Ids on the access control list

usernames.description: Usernames for users on the access control list

groupIds.description: Group Ids on the access control list

videoId.description: Id of video to replace on webcast

redirectVod.description: Default=true. Specify whether or not to redirect to the video automatically. If false, the user is taken to the Webcast Landing page instead.

password.description: Only videos with Public access control can update the password with a value

start.description: Start time to trim video in timespan format (e.g. 00:00:00). Minutes and seconds should be from 0-59.

end.description: End time to trim video in timespan format (e.g. 00:00:00). Minutes and seconds should be from 0-59.

approvalProcessStepsCount.description: Total number of steps in the approval process

reason.description: Reason for approving or rejecting the video

accessControlEntity.description: This provides explicit rights to a User/Group/Channel along with editing rights (CanEdit) to a video. If any value is invalid, it is rejected while valid values are still associated with the video.

id.description: Id of access control entity to give access to

name.description: Name of access control entity to give access to (used only if the id is not known)

type.description: Type of entity to be updated: User/Group/Channel

canEdit.description: Specifies whether or not the entity is granted edit ability and should be true or false. (Include either id or name, both are not required)

categoryPolicyItem.description: Used to add or update the users/groups that may manage restricted categories.

id.description: Id of access control entity to give access to

itemType.description: Category role. Can be a CategoryContributor or CategoryManager. Only managers can edit the category itself, along with its content.

eventQuestionOption.description: This is an enum and can have the following values: [IDENTIFIED, SELFSELECT, ANONYMOUS]

videoSourceType.description:
This is an enum and can have the following values: PresentationProfile, Rtmp, SipAddress, WebexTeam, WebexLiveStream, Zoom, Vod, Pexip, WebrtcSinglePresenter

Note that WebrtcSinglePresenter represents Webcam and Screenshare source in rev UI

This field is required to create/edit WebexLiveStream event.

searchEventsRequest.description: At least one of the parameters should be specified in the request. If all of the search terms are not provided in the request, a Bad Request response is returned by Rev.  If both the startDate and endDate search terms are not provided, they are defaulted to set a range equal to one year (i.e. 365 days).

scrollId.description: The scrollId returned in first request to search. This can be passed in subsequent requests to fetch next set of results. This is forward only and you cannot get back the search results that are scrolled once.

startDate.description: Search parameter to use to match those events that are set to start on or after the date specified. Value should be less than or equal to endDate. If not specified, it assumes a value of endDate - 365 days.

endDate.description: Search parameter to use to match those events that are set to start on or before the date specified. Value should be greater than or equal to startDate. If not specified, it assumes a value of the current date.

sortField.description: Name of the field in the event that will be used to sort the dataset in the response. Default is 'Title'

size.description: Number of records in the dataset to return per search request. Default is 100, minimum is 50 and maximum is 500.

customFields.description: List of custom fields to use when searching for events. All of the fields provided are concatenated as AND in the search request. The value to the property 'Value' is required.

eventRtmpInfo.description: Used if recording a rtmp stream as the video source.

url.description: The RTMP push Url to use with the scheduled event.

key.description: The RTMP Stream key to secure the RTMP push Url.

webcastType.description: Scheduled event type used for integrations, default value is Rev.

eventWebexTeamInfo.description: Used if recording a Webex Team meeting as the video source.

eventZoomInfo.description: Used if recording a Zoom meeting as the video source.

eventPreProduction.description: Use if creating a pre-production event to set designated pre-production attendees and duration.

duration.description: Timespan in hours and minutes that the pre-production webcast occurs before the Main webcast begins (Example: 04:00:00, 1.06:00:00)

attendeeJoinMethod.description: Attendee join method. Only required when 'accesscontrol' is Public. Default is 'Registration'. When set to 'Anonymous', no attendee specific details are collected or registered.

attendeeCount.description: The sum of the count of attendee and account admin in user type.

sortField.description: Default=FullName. Field to sort results against

count.description: Number of matching records to return in the response. Default is 50. Maximum is 500.

scrollId.description: The scrollId returned in first request to search. This can be passed in subsequent requests to fetch next set of results. This is forward only and you cannot get back the search results that are scrolled once.

q.description: Search query. When specified, searches the Search Fields for the specified string.

searchField.description:
A comma-separated list of fields to include in search.

Supported fields: 'FullName', 'Email', 'ZoneName', 'StreamType', 'IpAddress', 'Browser', 'OsFamily', 'StreamAccessed', 'PlayerDevice', 'OsName', 'UserType', 'Username', 'AttendeeType'

runNumber.description: The current run of the referred event. Defaults to Main Event runNumber(0). Should be passed for pre-production.

status.description: User session status. Supported values: 'All', 'Online', 'Offline'. Default is 'All'.

attendeeDetails.description: The shape of data to return in the response. Supported values: 'Base', 'All' and 'Counts'. Default is 'Base'. 'Counts' returns total count for host (hostCount), moderator (moderatorCount), and attendees (attendeeCount). 'Base' returns just 'UserId', 'Username', 'Email', 'StartTime', 'SessionId', 'FullName'. The values for the total count are also included. 'All includes 'Base' details, metrics, session, system, and user details. The values for the total count are also included.

attendeeCount.description: The sum of the count of attendee and account admin in user type.

status.description: Indicates the state of the real-time aggregation of a webcast. Possible values: 'Active', 'Initiated'. Active = webcast is currently aggregating. Initiated = a request to start aggregating is processed.

userName.description: Username submitting the comment. This user must exist in Rev. Unless the user has been assigned the Account Admin role, this user must also match the authenticated user making the API call.
Username of user submitting the comment. This user must exist in Rev. Only users with the Account Admin Role have the ability to specify a userName other than the currently authenticated user

commentId.description: Target comment ID. Comments may be nested a single layer deep. If not specified or null then this comment will be added as a top-level comment. If commentId refers to a top-level comment then this comment will be added as a child. If commentId refers to a child comment then this comment will be added as a sibling instead of being further nested. This matches the behavior of Rev UI commenting

authCode.description: Value of XXX for initial request and extend session

grantType.description: The value should be set to authorization_code for the initial session request and set to refresh_token to extend an existing session

redirectUri.description: URL of web page to load after Rev credentials have been entered by the user. This page is where the final authentication steps will be performed and from which all subsequent API calls may be made. This value must be URL encoded.

refreshToken.description: Not applicable for initial request and can be omitted. After the initial request this value must be present and the value returned from the initial call for session extension. This value may remain the same for a given session and can be used repeatedly in extend session requests as long as the session remains valid. Each extend session generates a new accessToken value therefore the full authorization string must be recalculated after each extend session request before using in subsequent API calls.

code.description: Value of authorization code received in the authorize call for initial access token

client_id.description: Client_id (apikey) Configured in the Rev client

grant_type.description: The value should be set to authorization_code for the initial session request and set to refresh_token to get new access token using refresh token

redirect_uri.description: URL of web page to load after Rev credentials have been entered by the user. This page is where the final authentication steps will be performed and from which all subsequent API calls may be made. This value must be URL encoded.

refresh_token.description: Not required for initial request (grant_type=authorization_code) and can be omitted. Required to get a new access token using the refresh token (grant_type=refresh_token). This value may remain the same for a given session and can be used repeatedly in extend session requests as long as the session remains valid. Each extend session generates a new accessToken value therefore the full authorization string must be recalculated after each extend session request before using in subsequent API calls.

code_verifier.description: Applicable for initial request (grant_type=authorization_code). This is the original code_verifier that was signed and sent as the code_challenge in the authorize call. Rev will sign this using the same S256 algorithm and compare with the code_challenge received earlier to match. If it doesn't match, request for token will be denied.

accessToken.description: The Vbrick access token to identify user which will be used for API calls

refreshToken.description: The refresh token that can be used to refresh an access_token when it expires.

username.description: Username of the logged in user.

firstName.description: FirstName of the logged in user.

lastName.description: LastName of the logged in user.

access_token.description: The Vbrick access token to identify user which will be used for API calls

refresh_token.description: The refresh token that can be used to refresh an access_token when it expires.

username.description: Username of the logged in user.

firstName.description: FirstName of the logged in user.

lastName.description: LastName of the logged in user.

accessToken.description: The Vbrick access token to identify user which will be used for API calls

csrfToken.description: The CSRF token used by the Rev

authorization_endpoint.description: URL of the authorization server's authorization endpoint.

token_endpoint.description: URL of the authorization server's token endpoint.

scopes_supported.description: JSON array containing a list of the OAuth 2.0 scope values that this authorization server supports.

response_types_supported.description: JSON array containing a list of the OAuth 2.0 response_type values that this authorization server supports.

grant_types_supported.description: JSON array containing a list of the OAuth 2.0 grant type values that this authorization server supports.

code_challenge_methods_supported.description: JSON array containing a list of Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE) code challenge methods supported by this authorization server.

userinfo_endpoint.description: URL of the authorization server's user info endpoint.

fileName.description: Data object of supplemental file details attached to the video. Multiple files can be assigned.

transcriptionFilesMetadataItem.description:
Transcription files metadata object. Field name is TranscriptionFiles.

Only .srt or .vtt files should be uploaded.

View Supported Languages in the Technical Requirements guide for ongoing updates and supported language codes.

fileName.description: Filename of attached file payload. Must end with .srt or .vtt file extension

language.description: Must be a supported language code

enum.description: Options of custom field to set in case of "Select" type.

id.description: Id of the custom field in the system.

name.description: Name of the custom field in the system.

required.description: Is custom field required in the system.

displayedToUsers.description: Is custom field dispalyed to user.

customFieldRequest.description: Video/Webcast custom field value. id and/or name must be included

id.description: Id of the custom field in the system

name.description: Name of the custom field in rev. If id is not provided, custom field is looked up by name.

value.description: Value of the custom field in the system

parentCategoryId.description: Id of parent category to add the category as a child category. If specified, the Id needs to exist in Rev.

restricted.description: Default=false. When true, the category is restricted and only the users/groups in categoryPolicyItems may add or edit content in the category or modify the category itself.

name.description: Name of the category to edit

restricted.description: Default=false. When true, the category is restricted and only the users/groups in categoryPolicyItems may add or edit content in the category or modify the category itself.

parentCategoryId.description: Id of parent category with this category as child

restricted.description: Specifies if the category is restricted.

activeVideos.description: Number of active videos in the category

inActiveVideos.description: Number of inactive videos in the category

totalVideos.description: Total number of videos in the category

url.description: Url of the video to add to the system

title.description: Title of the video being uploaded. If title is not specified, API uses linked filename as the title.

description.description: Description is set to null if not specified

uploader.description: This is the Rev username that identifies the user the video is attached to. If not specified, or the username does not exist in Rev, the link is rejected.

owner.description: Rev User the video is attached to. If the User does not exist in Rev, the request is rejected.

categories.description:
An array of category names that is attached to the video. If no categories are specified, or the category does not exist in Rev, it is not attached. This array is provided through the video metadata file and obtained through the Get Categories endpoint.

Note: You should only use category names OR categoryIds but not both.

categoryIds.description:
An array of category Ids that is attached to the video. If the category does not exist in Rev, the upload will fail. This array is provided through the video metadata file and obtained through the Get Categories endpoint.

Note: You should only use category names OR categoryIds but not both.

tags.description: An array of strings tagged to the video

isActive.description: Default=false. Status of the video after it is uploaded.

enableRatings.description: Default=true. This enables or disables ratings for the uploaded video.

enableDownloads.description: Default=false. This enables or disables downloading of the video from Rev.

enableComments.description: Default=true. This enables or disables comments for the uploaded video.

legacyViewCount.description: Retain the total views count from an outside system as an optional param.

password.description: A password for Public Video Access Control. Use this field when the videoAccessControl is set to Public. If not, this field is ignored.

customFields.description:
An array of customFields attached to a video/webcast. If the customField does not exist in Rev or invalid values found for picklist, the upload fails. If values are not provided for a picklist and/or text field, they are not set for the video but the upload proceeds. The Get Custom Fields endpoint retrieves a list of custom fields.

Note: If custom field is marked required in Rev, it must be provided in API call, otherwise it is optional. If it is required and not provided, the upload is rejected. Picklist types must be valid.

title.description: Name given to the video. Defaults to the SIP address if not provided.

sipAddress.description: SIP address for the video recording. Normally the conference room SIP address.

audioOnly.description: Record only the audio of the SIP call if it's true. It is false by default.

scheduledRecordingId.description: Recording Id that needs to be stopped or cancelled

videoId.description: Id of video to stop recording

parentZoneId.description: Id of parent zone if creating a child zone

supportsMulticast.description: Specify if the zone supports multicast streams

ipAddresses.description: Individual Ip addresses added to the zone

overrideAccountSlideDelay.description: Specifies to override the account slide delay settings

revConnectEnabled.description: Designate the zone a Rev Connect zone

childZones.description: An array of childzone objects of arbitrary nested depth, excluded here to avoid circular references.

zoneRevConnectSetting.description: When revConnectEnabled, add or edit a Rev Connect Zone.

disableFallback.description: Disables fallback to a unicast stream (if available) which means the zone only supports multicast or Rev Connect.

maxZoneMeshes.description: 0; Defines the upper limit of what can be used within the zone based on licensing retrictions.

zoneRendition.description: Rendition selection for Auto Unicast of Cloud Streams in zone.  All bitrates are seleced by default.  All bitrates must be selected if any zone device is a DME that has version lower than 3.28.

start.description: Starting Ip address for the range

end.description: Ending Ip address for the range

liveOnly.description: Specifies if no VOD videos retrieved if true

streams.description: Rev stream names added to the zone from this device

name.description: Required. Name of the Channel, must be unique.

members.description: Users/groups to add as channel members. Includes a flag to indicate if a member is acting as a channel administrator.

type.description: Indicates if a channel member is a user or a group entity

roleTypes.description: Indicates if a user or group is a Channel Administrator, Channel Contributor or Channel Member.

name.description: Name of the playlist. Must be unique.

videoIds.description: Ids of videos to add to playlist. At least one video is required.

videoId.description: Video Ids to edit in the playlist

action.description: Action to be taken - Add or Remove.

useAccountRecordingDevice.description:
Default: false.

If false, a DME defined in the presentation profile is used as the recording device. If true, the account primary/secondary recording device is used.

startDate.description:
Start date/time in UTC.

Default: current date/time. If not specified, current time is used. Example: 2018-05-21T20:20:00Z

endDate.description:
End date/time in UTC. Default: 2 hours after the startDate.

The default duration (2 hours) is a configurable system setting. The max duration is 10 hours by default. Example: 2018-05-21T20:20:00Z

title.description:
The title of the recording.

Default: the presentation profile name.

auditResponse.description: CSV file with the following fields: when, entityKey, messageKey, principal, entityId, currentState, previousState

ResourceType.description: Indicates the type of resource the initiated the IQ credits. Possible value: Video or Webcast.

Creator.title: revIqCreditsUsageCreator
Creator.description: User who created the resource. For webcasts, user who created it. For videos, user who uploaded it.

Usage.description: Type of transaction that initiated the IQ credits. Possible values: Transcription, Translation, UserTagging.

Languages.description: Target languages used when the resource was transcribed or translated. Does not apply for UserTagging.

When.description: Date and time when the transaction occured.

registrationFieldAnswer.description:
RegistrationFields used in webcast endpoints. If the registrationFields does not exist in Rev or invalid values are found for picklists, an error is returned. If values are not provided for a picklist and/or text field, they are not set (the endpoint proceeds).

Note: If a webcast registration field is marked required in Rev, it must be provided in API call, otherwise it is optional. If it is required and not provided, the call is rejected. Picklist types must be valid.

id.description: Id of the registration field in Rev

name.description: Name of the registration field in Rev
Name of the custom registration field is displayed to users

fieldType.description: Type of field. Can be Text or Select.

required.description: Default=false. Specifies whether the registrant is required to complete the field when registering for the event.

options.description: Field values when FieldType=picklist. Required if FieldType=picklist.

includeInAllWebcasts.description: Default=false. Specifies if the field is included in each public Webcast that is created.

externalId.description: External questionId if any are in external system. Default is blank.

isAnonymous.description: Default=false. When true, question is set to anonymous.

closeReason.description: The reason the question is closed. Values include [Declined, FollowUp, Answered, RepliedDirectly]

isPublic.description: Default=true. Specifies if the answer is Private or Public.

whenAnswered.description: Timestamp when the question is answered

userEntity.description: The user that asks/answers a question. Defaults to the authenticated API user. If specified, the user must have at least view permission on the Webcast (Attendee, Account Admin, Moderator, or Host).

timeStamp.description: Time in video when user paused watching.

sessionId.description: A unique ID that refers to the previous playback session

timeStamp.description: The position in the video from which to resume watching. Format is hh:mm:ss (i.e. 00:01:00 for one minute into video)

start.description: Date and time when the maintenance is to start.

end.description: Date and time when the maintenance is to end.

validUntil.description: Date until key is valid. Only if the key is in rotation.

count.description: The number of notifications returned. Up to 100 may be returned.

videoIds.description: Ids of videos to return data for. If no Ids are specified, data for all videos in the system are returned. Maximum video Ids can be passed are 50.

after.description: If after date is used, only video views with a start date after the specified date (up to 31 days) are included in the response. If both dates are used, video views between the specified dates are returned, not exceeding 31 days. If no dates are specified, video views between the current date and 31 days in the past from the start date are returned.

before.description: If before date is used, only video views with a start date before the specified date (up to 31 days) are included in the response. If both dates are used, video views between the specified dates are returned, not exceeding 31 days. If no dates are specified, video views between the current date and 31 days in the past from the start date are returned.

scrollId.description: The scrollId returned in first request to search. This can be passed in subsequent requests to fetch next set of results. This is forward only and you cannot get back the search results that are scrolled once.
